					Dear Hagop,

					 

					Please note that as per GIG,  reinsurers have noted the negative points including loss of recovery and delay in notification. GIG is having hard time trying to convince them. Additionally they have higher salvage quotes from the market which would minimise the loss.

					 

					However, GIG will continue to try and convince the reinsurers to consider the claim on exceptional basis based on our request by proposing below loss assessment:

					 

Claim for damaged goods with reasonable market value

 

SR; 110,939.00

Less salvage 25%

SR: 27,734.75

 

Less policy deductible

STP losses:

Warehouses: 2% of claim amount minimum SR 50,000/- any one accident or occurrence per location

SR; 50,000.00

SR; 77,734.75

Net amount to consider subject to policy terms and insured to retain all the claimed items

 

SR; 33,204.25

					 

					Please confirm the above computation to progress the matter.

					Dear Hagop,

					 

					Please note that GIG have requested the below remaining document/Info so they can meet and discuss the claim,

					 

					1)Contract with warehouse specifying who is responsible for maintenance of the warehouse;

					3)Statement of the persons who first noticed the damage and maintenance company, detailing when/how/where the rainwater entered;

					5)Formal valued Claim submitted to the responsible parties holding them liable.( including item no, description, unit price and total claim);

					6)Appointment and contact for joint survey;

					8)Attached claim form duly completed in all respects.

					9)Loss notification was received only after a lapse of around two months, which has prejudiced the matter. Please comment.

					 

					Can you pls share with me your comments on the above so we can proceed

					 

					Thanks

					 

					Firas Al Asaad

mailto:Moneer.Albalawi@nascosaudi.com> >; Hattan Halabi <Hattan.Halabi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hattan.Halabi@chalhoub.com> >
					Subject: RE: Rain Damage - Level Shoes warehouse- Nasco Ref.N-GA-24-43 

					 

					CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
					تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

					Dear Sirs,

					 

					This is to update you that the insurer`s surveyor have visited your warehouse on February 1, 2024, Insurer findings are as follow “ without prejudice” :

					During their attendance Mr. Muneer, Assistant Manager was also present.

					 

					1.       It was reported that rain water on 16/11/2023 affected the Level shoes warehouse and landed cost of the damaged goods was indicated as SAR 110,939. It is noted that claim notification was received only on 28 January 2024. This notification was received only after a lapse of around two months, which has prejudiced the matter.

					2.       169 damaged boxes of mixed brands were claimed damaged. Generally some of the cartons appeared affected. However as far as could be seen, the water does not appear to have penetrated deep and the goods are dry now and if required can be sold with discount or sold as a lot in salvage,

					3.       Insurer have not yet received overseas suppliers invoices for the reported claimed goods.

					4.       The steel frame storage was fixed to the wall and there was no space between side wall and storage.

					Dear Hagop,

					 

					Please note that as per GIG,  reinsurers have noted the negative points including loss of recovery and delay in notification. GIG is having hard time trying to convince them. Additionally they have higher salvage quotes from the market which would minimise the loss.

					 

					However, GIG will continue to try and convince the reinsurers to consider the claim on exceptional basis based on our request by proposing below loss assessment:

					 

Claim for damaged goods with reasonable market value

 

SR; 110,939.00

Less salvage 25%

SR: 27,734.75

 

Less policy deductible

STP losses:

Warehouses: 2% of claim amount minimum SR 50,000/- any one accident or occurrence per location

mailto:Moneer.Albalawi@nascosaudi.com> >; Hattan Halabi <Hattan.Halabi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hattan.Halabi@chalhoub.com> >
					Subject: RE: Rain Damage - Level Shoes warehouse- Nasco Ref.N-GA-24-43 

					 

					CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
					تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

					Dear Sirs,

					 

					This is to update you that the insurer`s surveyor have visited your warehouse on February 1, 2024, Insurer findings are as follow “ without prejudice” :

					During their attendance Mr. Muneer, Assistant Manager was also present.

					 

					1.       It was reported that rain water on 16/11/2023 affected the Level shoes warehouse and landed cost of the damaged goods was indicated as SAR 110,939. It is noted that claim notification was received only on 28 January 2024. This notification was received only after a lapse of around two months, which has prejudiced the matter.

					2.       169 damaged boxes of mixed brands were claimed damaged. Generally some of the cartons appeared affected. However as far as could be seen, the water does not appear to have penetrated deep and the goods are dry now and if required can be sold with discount or sold as a lot in salvage,

					3.       Insurer have not yet received overseas suppliers invoices for the reported claimed goods.

					4.       The steel frame storage was fixed to the wall and there was no space between side wall and storage.

The steel frame storage was fixed to the wall and there was no space between side wall and storage.

					 

					If a claim is being pursued, kindly provide the following at this stage:

					 

					1.       Contract with warehouse specifying who is responsible for maintenance of the warehouse;

					2.       Contract with any maintenance company for periodic maintenance;

					3.       Statement of the persons who first noticed the damage and maintenance company, detailing when/how/where the rainwater entered;

					4.       Invoices identifying the claimed items;

					5.       Formal valued Claim submitted to the responsible parties holding them liable.( including item no, description, unit price and total claim);

					6.       Appointment and contact for joint survey;

					7.       Attached claim form duly completed in all respects.

					8.       Loss notification was received only after a lapse of around two months, which has prejudiced the matter. Please comment.

					 

					Appreciate receiving the above details in order to proceed further.
